item.title: Donald Trump Has Never Encouraged Violence
item.description:
The President in no way form or fashion has ever promoted or encouraged violence.

— Sarah Huckabee Sanders, White House press briefing

Claims:

Donald Trump Has Never Encouraged Violence
The Truth:
He has, on numerous occasions.

Fact Checks:

PolitiFact

We found one example — when Trump said, “If you see somebody getting ready to throw a tomato, knock the crap out of them, would you?” — that clearly fits the criteria of promoting or encouraging violence.

This was not an isolated incident; we found at least seven other examples in which Trump offered public musings that showed a tolerance for, and sometimes even a favorable disposition toward, physical violence.

The Washington Post

This is laughable.

Even if you don’t believe Trump has technically incited violence (which he has been sued for), he clearly nodded toward violence at his campaign rallies. Sometimes it was veiled; other times it was unmistakable. Sometimes he was talking about self-defense, but it was clear he was advocating for a “form of violence.”

item.title: Trump Fired Comey Only at Request of DoJ Officials
item.description:
I think he’s heard from the rank and file of the FBI, but particularly someone who had done a thorough review and someone who has the respect and reputation that the deputy attorney general has, he took that seriously. He took the recommendation seriously. And he made a decision based on that.

— Sarah Huckabee Sanders, Morning Joe interview

Claims:

Trump Fired Comey Only at Request of DoJ Officials
The Truth:
Trump later admitted he decided to fire Comey first, then sought justification from DoJ.

Fact Checks:

FactCheck.org
Trump, however, told NBC’s Lester Holt in a May 11 interview that he did not base his decision on Rosenstein’s recommendation.
